def _get_grouper(
    obj,
    key=None,
    axis=0,
    level=None,
    sort=True,
    observed=False,
    mutated=False,
    validate=True,
):
    # ...
    
    # validation and other checks

    if isinstance(key, (str, list)):
        keys = [key] if isinstance(key, str) else key
        # convert the list of group names to their corresponding columns
        keys = [obj.columns.get_loc(k) if k in obj.columns else k for k in keys]
    else:
        raise ValueError("Invalid group name")

    groupings = []
    exclusions = []

    for i, gpr in enumerate(keys):
        # Create the Grouping based on the group names or columns
        ping = Grouping(
            group_axis,
            gpr,
            obj=obj,
            name=None,
            level=level,
            sort=sort,
            observed=observed,
            in_axis=(gpr in obj.columns)
        )
        # Add the Grouping to the list of groupings
        groupings.append(ping)

    # ...

    # create the internals grouper
    grouper = BaseGrouper(group_axis, groupings, sort=sort, mutated=mutated)
    return grouper, exclusions, obj
